translated: The Peta-Stories🔽The Book of the Reptiles
. The Story of the Great Householder Ghost
“Excrement, urine, blood, and pus,
what is the result of eating these?
What deed did this woman do
who always eats blood and pus?
New clothes, beautiful and fine,
soft, pure, and smooth,
when given to her, become rags.
What deed did this woman do?”
“She was my wife, reverend Sir,
stingy, greedy, and miserly.
When I gave to ascetics and brahmins,
she scolded and reviled me.
